findings.description: The buy() function incorrectly transfers tokens FROM msg.sender TO owner (the current exchange owner) instead of transferring tokens FROM owner TO msg.sender (the buyer). Additionally, it transfers ownership (owner = msg.sender) to ANYONE who calls the function, allowing takeover of the exchange with a single transaction.
findings.reasoning: While this finding is related to the target vulnerability, it is not a front-running vulnerability. It is an ownership takeover vulnerability.

findings.description: The contract calls token.transferFrom() without checking the return value. In Solidity 0.4.x, ERC20 transfer/transferFrom functions return boolean success values. If the token transfer fails (returns false), execution continues, allowing ownership transfer without actual payment.
findings.reasoning: This finding is related to the target vulnerability but is not a front-running vulnerability. It is an unchecked return value vulnerability.

findings.description: The changePrice() function has no explicit visibility specifier (defaults to public), making it callable by anyone when it should be owner-only. This is compounded by the flawed ownership transfer in buy().
findings.reasoning: This finding is related to the target vulnerability but is not a front-running vulnerability. It is a missing function modifiers vulnerability.

target_assessment.type_match_reasoning: The target vulnerability (front-running) was not mentioned in any of the findings.

notes: The target vulnerability (front-running) was not identified in the audit findings. The findings provided were related to the target vulnerability but were not front-running vulnerabilities.
